title: Bots
body:
So now I realise why LoL is losing players, Bots.

I started a smurf account to see what low ranks and new players have to go through, well fuck me, EVERY game is all bots.

No wonder there are no new players joining.

replies.body: League of legends has peaked but there is still some growth. There are plenty of new players joining league though, just not as many as when it was the rage of popularity.

> [{quoted}](name=Requiemsfire,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=nMIYMiRc,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-08-29T08:52:22.100+0000)
>
> League of legends has peaked but there is still some growth. There are plenty of new players joining league though, just not as many as when it was the rage of popularity.

The point is though, Riot have lost control of their game.

It used to belong to Riot, it now belongs to the script kiddies who run the bots.

Scripters are getting banned. Back in 2012 - 2014 they were everywhere and none ever got banned. Don't talk about things you don't understand because you saw one bot in a low-level game. Go play any MMORPG and you'll see bots. Go and play any FPS and you'll encounter an aimbotter. Heck, people even have scripts for mobile games. PokÃ©mon GO was botted on to Hell and back. The point is that every game has cheaters, no matter how advanced the anti-cheat is, the cheaters will bypass it and it's a war that is back and forth.

Wow, you are some arrogant jerk.

"Don't talk about things you don't understand because you saw one bot in a low-level game"

You have crested the height of ignorance.  Try actually playing a co-op game with a below level 30 account.
Then you'll find you are the uninformed.  Hypocrisy is strong.

yeah but coop vs ai games are made much harder for new players since all their teammates are bots who go like 0-13 in 10min and just feed like mad, simply powerfarming ip. I played together with a friend who was lvl10 and they're really good and I am trying to encourage them to just play pvp but when we played together vs bots even I had difficulty dealing with the super fed enemy bots whilst the other 3 people in my game just ran down lane without any items and my friend is like how can we win this? it's over. I mean eventually an experienced player will get items, build almost full damage and just outplay bots and then just push and carry (though annie, malphite, shyvanna and nocturne bots are extremely grueling to play against when they are that fed and can wombo you without giving you much time to dodge). It doesn't feel good almost losing to bots and the game is just so frustrating like this.

I am lvl30, been playing for almost 6 months now and I consider myself only slightly below the average league player in skill, but I was struggling with a teammate who didn't play too badly and only 3 feeders to deal with. I can't imagine a new player who is just coming to grips with the game enjoying getting curb stomped by Ai with 4 noncommunicating itemless feeding bots.
it's actually harder than playing 5v1 custom matches and trying to get pentakills.

> [{quoted}](name=Plutooh,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=nMIYMiRc,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-08-29T09:43:11.453+0000)

their downfall was when Tencent completely bought them

While these "bots" are getting improved in numbers, is there anything as players we can do? Honestly, the reporting system barely seems to work when you 1v5 in co-op vs ai and the least we could do is crack down on sheer numbers.

I agree a simple bot check script (easy to make but much harder to fit into the league client without being easily exploitable I do understand that it's not as easy at it sounds but come on riot), that checks the values from their past 20 games should send a captcha to accounts that are suspected of botting and this could ban them. It's not that hard to spot a feeder bot as compared to a human player and the higher quality bots whilst you shouldn't discriminate aren't as detrimental to the experience of new players playing.

Came here to complain about the same thing. Every AI game I play, there are 2-4 bots on my team. Reporting them doesn't seem to help, or at least I'm never notified that action has been taken. Does Riot have ANYTHING to say at all on this issue?

Honestly me personally I try helping league as much I tell my mates at school etc and they are all starting to play and like it the only thing they don't like about the game is the players verbal abuse .
honestly people should not be swearing and letting other people down in game everyone starts off as a rookie

If they aren't playing with friends (and if they are use voice chat via discord, skype, teamspeak etc)
tell them to /muteall at the start of the game.

Agreed. I've been in an "ai vs players" game and have literally been the only human there. managed to win the game by going 40/2/0 or something around that. Reported all the accounts. but yes, botting is a real problem
it wasn't as bad for me. instead every game was all smurfs
